notes:
1. Definition

Adhesive bonding is a joining process in which a non-metallic material (the adhesive) is used to join two surfaces (adherends) together. The adhesive solidifies to produce a bond.

2. Common Types of Adhesives

  • Epoxies: Two-part systems (resin and hardener) that cure to form a very strong, rigid, and durable bond. Excellent chemical and temperature resistance.
  • Cyanoacrylates: One-part adhesives that cure rapidly in the presence of moisture. Commonly known as 'super glue'. Good for small parts and fast assembly.
  • Anaerobics: Cure in the absence of oxygen and the presence of metal ions. Commonly used as threadlockers for fasteners and for sealing pipe threads.
  • Polyurethanes: Can be formulated to be flexible or rigid. Offer good toughness and impact resistance.

3. Advantages of Adhesive Bonding

  • Distributes stress more uniformly over the entire joint area, reducing stress concentrations.
  • Can effectively join dissimilar materials (e.g., metal to plastic).
  • Can simultaneously join and seal a joint against fluids.
  • Often provides a better aesthetic appearance than mechanical fasteners.

4. Disadvantages

  • Thorough surface preparation is critical for a strong bond.
  • Limited service temperature range for many adhesives.
  • Cure time can be long, slowing production.
  • Joints are difficult to disassemble.

solvedExamples.question: Which of the following is a major advantage of adhesive bonding compared to using a single bolt to join two plates?

options.text: The joint is easy to disassemble.
It distributes the load over a larger area.
It has a higher service temperature.

solvedExamples.explanation: A bolt concentrates the load around the hole, creating a high stress concentration. An adhesive bond distributes the load over the entire bonded surface, resulting in a much more uniform stress distribution and often a stronger joint in fatigue.

solvedExamples.question: An adhesive that is commonly used as a threadlocker for bolts, curing only when air is excluded, is known as:
solvedExamples.explanation: Anaerobic adhesives are specifically designed to cure in the absence of oxygen and in the presence of metal ions, which makes them perfect for the small gaps in threaded fasteners.
